definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]

sentences.english: He dashed the cup down in his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他生氣了，使勁把杯子擲下。

sentences.english: My island sways in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我的心島也在海風中使勁搖移。

sentences.english: The visitor hammered against the door with his fists.
sentences.chinese: 來訪者用拳頭使勁地錘打着大門。

sentences.english: First, shake out as much water as you can and dry it off with a paper towel.
sentences.chinese: 首先你要使勁的甩幹它，然後用紙巾儘量吸乾。

sentences.english: And he tugged at her apron and the hands.
sentences.chinese: 他使勁拉她的圍裙和手。

sentences.english: The harder you push, the more quickly that cart will move.
sentences.chinese: 你越使勁推，車就越跑的快。

sentences.english: Bear woke up with a start and pulled his long tail hard as he could.
sentences.chinese: 熊被驚醒過來，開始使勁地拉尾巴。

sentences.english: She muscled through the throngs of people, frantically searching for David.
sentences.chinese: 她使勁擠過人羣，拼命尋找戴維。

sentences.english: The taxi driver braked hard as the boy ran onto the road ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 孩子跑到她前面的路上時那位出租車司機使勁踩閘。

sentences.english: He quickly opens the door and fumbles an arm and pulls it hard.
sentences.chinese: 他趕緊打開車門，摸到一隻手臂，使勁拽。

sentences.english: I scrubbed my hands but I couldn't get the ink off.
sentences.chinese: 我使勁搓手，但不能把墨水洗掉。

sentences.english: We wrestled the heavy box onto the truck.
sentences.chinese: 我們使勁把那隻沈重的箱子搬上卡車。

sentences.english: The landlord banged on the door and turned the handle. The door was locked.
sentences.chinese: 旅館老伴使勁擂門，並轉動門把手，門是鎖着的。

sentences.english: He strained his eyes trying to see her clearly.
sentences.chinese: 他使勁掙開眼睛想清楚地看到她。

sentences.english: He squeezed his nose, closed his mouth, and blew really hard.
sentences.chinese: 他擠擠鼻子，合上嘴，並且使勁兒吹。

sentences.english: She began to moan and tried to pull out herself by arching her body.
sentences.chinese: 她開始發出“嗯嗯”的聲音，身體使勁往上拱。

definition: one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
